name: Edelweiss
description:
'''Edelweiss''' were an Austrian [[electronic dance music]] group consisting of remixers Martin Gletschermayer, [[Matthias Schweger]] and [[Walter Werzowa]]. The group is best known for their 1988 worldwide hit "[[Bring Me Edelweiss]]", and their European hit "Starship Edelweiss".  

Edelweiss reached the number one position with their hit "Bring Me Edelweiss", featuring Austrian folk singer Maria Mathis, who also did the live performances (and later recorded an updated version in 1999). The single was a hit in many European countries, supposedly by following the instructions given in [[The KLF]]'s book ''[[The Manual]]''. Borrowing large parts of its melody from [[ABBA]]'s "[[SOS (ABBA song)|SOS]]" and [[Indeep]]'s "[[Last Night a DJ Saved My Life (song)|Last Night a DJ Saved My Life]]", the song humorously targeted Austrian ski resorts and [[yodeling]] and sold five million copies worldwide. [[Bill Drummond]], one of the authors of ''The Manual (How to Have a Number One the Easy Way)'', mentioned the group in the epilogue of the German release of the book, which was originally published in 1989 (in [[English language|English]]).{{Citation needed|date=November 2009}}
